creator: johan.ferner@lm.se
text:
In APR 0.9.0 the changelog says:
*) Remove the APRVARS system; apps should use apr-config. [Greg Stein]

However, Webapp tries to find the APRVARS file. Meaning I can't build
the connector easily.

I found an old webapp src tarball with apr b1 (?!).
That took me beyond the configure phase....

I would suggest bundling an apr that works in the webapp.

Ah Yes, I see now.... :)

The directory 
http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/release/v1.2.0/src/
contains the apr (?!).

The README file in the directory
http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-4.0/release/v4.1.10/
indicates that the v1.2.0/src/ directory is the complete dist. 

"This version of Tomcat can use either WARP 1.0 or AJP 1.3 to connect to native
webservers. A wide assortment of connectors are available in the
jakarta-tomcat-connectors binary folder."

However, the connectors are in the
http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-4.0/release/v4.1.10/src
directory.
and the apr to use is in the v1.2.0/src directory. Not at http://apr.apache.org.

Wow :) I think I see the light here but PLEASE fix this web server file mess.
I really shouldn't be this hard to compile your software.

"mod_webapp is deprecated and unsupported due to lack of developer interest.
Please use mod_jk, or jk2"
